properties.areaDesc: Laguna Madre From the Port Of Brownsville to the Arroyo Colorado; Coastal waters from Port Mansfield TX to the Rio Grande River out 20 NM
properties.headline: Marine Weather Statement issued February 12 at 1:29PM CST by NWS Brownsville TX
properties.description:
At 129 pm, the combination of a moist airmass lingering over the
relative cool Bay and Gulf waters will continue to produce areas
of marine fog this afternoon across the coastal portions of
Cameron County. Visibilities between 1 and 3 miles can be expected
which will pose difficult navigation for unexperienced mariners
and pilots. These areas of marine fog will mainly affect the far
southern portions of the Laguna Madre and the marine locations out
to 20 nautical miles offshore of Cameron County.

Mariners should be especially cautious when piloting around the
Queen Isabella Causeway.

If you must navigate, proceed with caution. Use proper fog signals.
Make sure all running lights are on. Remember to use your radar
and compass.

Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or your local media for further
updates.

NWSheadline: AREAS OF MARINE FOG AFFECTING FAR EASTERN CAMERON COUNTY
